original: Bursie, Gustaf, överstelöjtnant, Göteborg, f. 31/12/95 i Oslo, Norge, av överste Herman B. o. Christine Hef-tye. G. 29 m. Ingeborg Neumüller. Barn: Marianne f. 31, Bengt 33. — Studiex. i Skara 16, off:ex, 18, AIH-Shk 20-24, SS 26, kurs v. artrskjutsk. å Skillingaryd 26. Gen. Mot. Nord. A-B servicesk. 30. Studrres. t. Frankr., Ital. 21-22, Schweiz 38. Fänr. i Fortif. 18, undilöjtn. 21, löjtn. 21, fortistabs-off. 33, kapten 33, major 40, fortifik:-befälh. v. Gbgs kustart :försv. fr. 42, överstelöjtn. 46. Lär. v. Ingitrupp. stud:komp. 26-27, v. bef :övn. f. off. 28, repetitör v. AIHS 28-30, lär. v. KS 33-36, lär. v. KSS 37-40, tjg. v. ingistab. i Bodens fästn. 30-33, v. Fortif. huv:stat. 33-35, v. marinför-valtn. 35-37, tjf. chef v. Fortrstyr. be-fäs’tn:byrå 37-39, fort:off. v. L armé-förd. 40-41, fort:bef. v. Älvsb. fästn. 41-42. RSO, SkytteM.
translated: Bursie, Gustaf, Lieutenant Colonel, Gothenburg, born December 31, 1895 in Oslo, Norway, son of Colonel Herman B. and Christine Hef-tye. Married in 1929 to Ingeborg Neumüller. Children: Marianne born in 1931, Bengt born in 1933. Completed his high school education in Skara in 1916, graduated from Officer's School in 1918, studied at the Artillery and Engineering School in Stockholm from 1920 to 1924, and completed a special course in marksmanship at Skillingaryd in 1926. General Manager of Mot. Nord. A-B servicesk. in 1930. Studied in France, Italy from 1921 to 1922 and Switzerland in 1938. Became a Second Lieutenant in Fortifications in 1918, Lieutenant in 1921, Fortress Staff Officer in 1933, Captain in 1933, Major in 1940, and Fortress Commander for Gothenburg's coastal defense from 1942 as a Lieutenant Colonel. Taught at the Ingitrupp study group from 1926-1927, served as a practice officer from 1928-1930, was a tutor at AIHS from 1928-1930, taught at KS from 1933-1936, taught at KSS from 1937-1940, worked at the Engineering Staff Office at Boden Fortress from 1930-1933, and was assigned to the Fortress Headquarters in Stockholm from 1933-1935. Served at the Naval Administration from 1935-1937, acted as temporary commander of the Fortress Control Bureau from 1937-1939, was a Fortress Officer in the Left Army Command from 1940-1941, and was the Fortress Commander for Älvsborg Fortress from 1941-1942. He was awarded RSO, SkytteM.

employmentHistory.name: Engineering Staff Office at Boden Fortress
